channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MT

item.title: Report E-2023080496
item.description:
Report E-2023080496

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report E-2023080407
item.description:
Report E-2023080407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of chem aqua 42171 (un1760) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 20 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023070368
item.description:
Report X-2023070368

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: GREAT FALLS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was discovered due to damage during transportation from container to feeder aircraft by the pilot and ground crew at our Great Fall Ramp location. During the course of travel a Uhaul fibreboard box had a side tear. Upon closer inspection, the DG agent identified contained undeclared dangerous goods among several other non-hazardous pieces. After completing a full inventory of the package a travelling veterinarian who was attempting to move his equipment from Texas to Montana following a procedure included a plastic one gallon jug of isopropyl alcohol. The remaining pieces within the shipment are tools of the trade or other assorted medical supplies. The other three packages in the shipment were not identified and are assumed to have moved to their final destination. Package is being held pending FAA investigation
